Text.Page:
I want you to be careful, . Enough people have seen you, and you've asked enough questions, that people are asking about you—and word is liable to get back to this mysterious treasure hunter.

You need to re-establish your cover story—that you're just another person helping out."That's probably a good idea."

Head out and make your way south to the Mysterious Ruins.

In the process, make a show of killing several of these big monsters.

When you get to the ruins, look for the Free Traders Collective group. They're gathering there, and I'd like to know why."I understand."

I see you're getting around, killing big monsters. I was starting to think you were just here to loot the ruins of the federation camp.

So is this just a social call...?"Actually, I'm looking for a missing person...a man dressed in black?"

The...man in black?

I might have seen that fellow....but it's been a while. Is he a friend of yours?"Let's just say that we share an interest..."

I see...

Well, if this "interest" of yours yields anything fruitful, we might just have something to talk about. And then my time might be worth money, after all."How much are we talking?"

Not more than I promised that treasure hunter, I assure you. Whoever delivers first takes the money.

This is all speculative, of course. If there's anything of value on this island, well, that would be news to me.

Do we understand one another?"I...believe we do. I'll be in touch."

And so we meet again. I hear you've been touring the disaster area. You must be very...curious.

Can I satisfy your curiosity?"I'm looking for a man in black. Apparently, he's gone missing."

That fellow?

He...I didn't realize he was missing...though I haven't seen him in some time now."Are you sure? He told me he was coming to talk to you."

Hm. Did he, now?

Well, it's interesting that he didn't mention you. We might be speaking of two different men in black.

In any event, I don't have any information for you."Well, if you can't help me, maybe I should talk to the Iron Order."

Those thugs? What would they know?

I wouldn't be surprised if they had something to do with all of this...the destruction of the World Tree, all those injuries and deaths...

But, please, by all means, if you must waste someone's time, I'd rather it was theirs and not mine."Okay. You've told me everything I need to know, anyway."
I thought I told you to get lost.<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"The man in black sent me."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>
What for? He has my answer. Does he think I'll give you a different answer?<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"We thought you might have reconsidered."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

What kind of game are you playing?

You listen to me: I held up my part of the bargain, and I still haven't seen any proof that he's held up his.

So unless you both want a good beating, you won't come back until you're ready to complete the deal."I'll...pass that along."

See that you do.

Because if you don't...if you and that treasure hunter don't deliver...you'll live just long enough to regret it.

Pass that along, too."You've made your point. I'm leaving."

Are you telling me all of the alliance magisters have had dealings with the treasure hunter?

The picture is still murky, but it's becoming clearer and clearer that this treasure hunter is the unifying thread...if not in fact the author of the destruction.

Okay, then, your next step should be finding him. I've got a better description of him, from Lam: black leather armor, with a dagger in his belt and twinswords on his back.

Lam says the treasure hunter's name is Zik."I've got it. I'll find him and get some answers."
